alert.note: Alert for Tazewell (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 11:49AM CST until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, De Witt, Logan, Mason, McLean, Menard, Sangamon, Tazewell and Woodford. In west central Illinois, Cass. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, Bloomington, Lincoln, Mason City, Normal, Morton, Chatham, Sherman, Le Roy, Riverton, Heyworth, El Paso, Petersburg, Tremont, Lexington, Athens, Mackinaw, Hudson, Atlanta and Delavan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
